title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002)
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Road Traffic (Recognition of Foreign
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Road Traffic (Recognition of Foreign 

Driving Licences) (Alberta) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited road traffic (recognition foreign driving licences) (alberta) order 2020

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002)
heading: In this Order “vehicle with automatic transmission” means a vehicle in
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order “vehicle with automatic transmission” means a vehicle in 
which no clutch pedal (or lever operated manually for category A, A1, A2 or 
AM) is present.
text_norm: 2 order vehicle automatic transmission mean vehicle clutch pedal (or lever operated manually category a1 a2 am) present

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002)
heading: It is declared that a licence or permit permitting a person to drive a
text_raw:
3. 

It is declared that a licence or permit permitting a person to drive a 
mechanically propelled vehicle, not being a licence or permit issued to a person 
to enable that person to learn or provisionally to drive such a vehicle, issued by 
the competent authority of the Canadian province of Alberta in a category 
which corresponds to category A1, AM or B in the Table to Regulation 6 of the 
Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006) is 
recognised for the purpose of exchange of that licence or permit for a driving 
licence.
text_norm: 3 declared licence permit permitting person drive mechanically propelled vehicle licence permit issued person enable person learn provisionally drive vehicle issued competent authority canadian province alberta category corresponds category a1 b table regulation 6 road traffic (licensing drivers) regulation 2006 (s.i no 537 2006) recognised purpose exchange licence permit driving licence

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002)
heading: 4. (1) A driving licence for category B being granted in exchange for a
text_raw:
4. (1) A driving licence for category B being granted in exchange for a 
licence or permit referred to in Article 3 shall only permit the person concerned 
to drive a vehicle with automatic transmission in that category. 

(2) Notwithstanding paragraph (1), where the competent authority referred 
to in Article 3 confirms that the person exchanging a driving licence or permit 
completed a test in a vehicle with manual transmission which demonstrates the 
necessary ability to drive the vehicle to the satisfaction of the licensing 
authority (within the meaning of section 21 (amended by section 50 (a) of the 
Road Safety Authority (Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness) Act 2012 (No. 
16 of 2012)) of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961)) the licence 
granted on exchange shall also permit the person to drive a vehicle with 
manual transmission in the category concerned. 

(3) Paragraph (2) shall not apply where, subsequent to the test referred to in 
that paragraph, the competent authority referred to in Article 3 issued the 
person with a licence which only permits that person to drive a vehicle with 
automatic transmission in the category concerned. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 17th March, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [74] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

10 March, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [74]

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order gives effect to an Agreement between Ireland and the Canadian 
Province of Alberta on the mutual exchange of driving licences. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [74] 5
